class.name: ComplianceLevel
class.doc: Compliance level for elements. The international standards defines an extensive set of metadata elements. Typically only a subset of the full number of elements is used. However, it is essential that a basic minimum number of metadata elements be maintained for a dataset.

class.name: Obligation
class.doc: Obligation of the element or entity. The enum values declared here duplicate the code list elements declared in the Obligation code list from the metadata package.

class.name: Profile
class.doc: An annotation mapping an interface, methods or fields to a profile.

class.name: Specification
class.doc: The specifications from which an interface, method or code list was derived. Some specifications are available both at OGC and ISO.

class.name: UML
class.doc: An annotation mapping each interface, methods or fields to the UML identifier where they come from.

interface.name: DirectPosition

method.name: getCoordinateReferenceSystem
method.doc: The coordinate reference system in which the coordinate is given. May be null if this particular DirectPosition is included in a larger object with such a reference to a coordinate reference system. In this case, the coordinate reference system is implicitly assumed to take on the value of the containing object's coordinate reference system.

method.name: getDimension
method.doc: The length of coordinate sequence (the number of entries). This is determined by the coordinate reference system.

method.name: getCoordinate
method.doc: A copy of the ordinates presented as an array of double values. Please note that this is only a copy (the real values may be stored in another format) so changes to the returned array will not affect the source DirectPosition. To manipulate ordinates, the following idiom can be used: There are a couple reasons for requerying a copy: We want an array of coordinates with the intend to modify it for computation purpose (without modifying the original DirectPosition), or we want to protect the array from future DirectPosition changes. If DirectPosition.getOrdinates() is guaranteed to not return the backing array, then we can work directly on this array. If we don't have this guarantee, then we must conservatively clone the array in every cases. Cloning the returned array is useless if the implementation cloned the array or was forced to returns a new array anyway (for example because the coordinates were computed on the fly) Precedence is given to data integrity over getOrdinates() performance. Performance concern can be avoided with usage of getOrdinate(int).

method.name: getOrdinate
method.doc: Returns the ordinate at the specified dimension.

method.name: setOrdinate
method.doc: Sets the ordinate value along the specified dimension.

method.name: equals
method.doc: Compares this direct position with the specified object for equality. Two direct positions are considered equal if the following conditions are meet: object is non-null and is an instance of DirectPosition. Both direct positions have the same number of dimension. Both direct positions have the same or equal coordinate reference system. For all dimension i, the ordinate value of both direct positions at that dimension are equals in the sense of equals(Object). In other words, Arrays.equals(getCoordinate(), object.getCoordinate()) returns true.

method.name: hashCode
method.doc: Returns a hash code value for this direct position. This method should returns the same value as: Arrays.hashCode(getCoordinate()) + getCoordinateReferenceSystem().hashCode() where the right hand side of the addition is omitted if the coordinate reference system is null.

interface.doc: Holds the coordinates for a position within some coordinate reference system. Since DirectPositions, as data types, will often be included in larger objects (such as geometries) that have references to coordinate reference system, the getCoordinateReferenceSystem method may returns null if this particular DirectPosition is included in a larger object with such a reference to a coordinate reference system. In this case, the coordinate reference system is implicitly assumed to take on the value of the containing object's coordinate reference system.

interface.name: Envelope

method.name: getCoordinateReferenceSystem
method.doc: Returns the envelope coordinate reference system, or null if unknown. If non-null, it shall be the same as lower corner and upper corner CRS.

method.name: getDimension
method.doc: The length of coordinate sequence (the number of entries) in this envelope. Mandatory even when the coordinate reference system is unknown.

method.name: getLowerCorner
method.doc: A coordinate position consisting of all the minimal ordinates for each dimension for all points within the Envelope.

method.name: getUpperCorner
method.doc: A coordinate position consisting of all the maximal ordinates for each dimension for all points within the Envelope.

method.name: getMinimum
method.doc: Returns the minimal ordinate along the specified dimension. This is a shortcut for the following without the cost of creating a temporary DirectPosition object: getLowerCorner.getOrdinate(dimension)

method.name: getMaximum
method.doc: Returns the maximal ordinate along the specified dimension. This is a shortcut for the following without the cost of creating a temporary DirectPosition object: getUpperCorner.getOrdinate(dimension)

method.name: getMedian
method.doc: Returns the median ordinate along the specified dimension. The result shall be equals (minus rounding error) to: (getMinimum(dimension) + getMaximum(dimension)) / 2

method.name: getSpan
method.doc: Returns the envelope span (typically width or height) along the specified dimension. The result shall be equals (minus rounding error) to: getMaximum(dimension) - getMinimum(dimension)

interface.doc: A minimum bounding box or rectangle. Regardless of dimension, an Envelope can be represented without ambiguity as two direct positions (coordinate points). To encode an Envelope, it is sufficient to encode these two points. This is consistent with all of the data types in this specification, their state is represented by their publicly accessible attributes.

class.name: MismatchedDimensionException

constructor.name: MismatchedDimensionException
constructor.doc: Creates an exception with no message.

constructor.name: MismatchedDimensionException
constructor.doc: Creates an exception with the specified message.

constructor.name: MismatchedDimensionException
constructor.doc: Creates an exception with the specified message and cause.

class.doc: Indicates that an operation cannot be completed properly because of a mismatch in the dimensions of object attributes.

interface.name: Position

method.name: getDirectPosition
method.doc: Returns the direct position. This method shall never returns null, but may returns this if invoked on an object which is already a DirectPosition instance.

interface.doc: A type consisting of either a direct position or of a point from which a direct position shall be obtained. The use of this data type allows the identification of a position either directly as a coordinate (variant direct) or indirectly as a point (variant indirect).

method.name: getName

method.doc: Identification of the schema language used.

method.name: getConstraintLanguage

method.name: getGraphicsFile
method.doc: Full application schema given as a graphics file.

method.doc: Full application schema given as a software development file.

method.name: getSoftwareDevelopmentFileFormat
method.doc: Software dependent format used for the application schema software dependent file.

class.name: Datatype

method.name: values
method.doc: Returns the list of Datatypes.

method.name: family
method.doc: Returns the list of enumerations of the same kind than this enum.

method.name: valueOf
method.doc: Returns the datatype that matches the given string, or returns a new one if none match it.

field.name: CLASS
field.doc: Descriptor of a set of objects that share the same attributes, operations, methods, relationships, and behavior.

field.name: CODE_LIST
field.doc: Flexible enumeration useful for expressing a long list of values, can be extended.

field.name: ENUMERATION
field.doc: Data type whose instances form a list of named literal values, not extendable.

field.name: CODE_LIST_ELEMENT
field.doc: Permissible value for a codelist or enumeration.

field.name: ABSTRACT_CLASS
field.doc: Class that cannot be directly instantiated.

field.name: AGGREGATE_CLASS
field.doc: Class that is composed of classes it is connected to by an aggregate relationship.

field.name: SPECIFIED_CLASS
field.doc: Subclass that may be substituted for its superclass.

field.name: DATATYPE_CLASS
field.doc: Class with few or no operations whose primary purpose is to hold the abstract state of another class for transmittal, storage, encoding or persistent storage.

field.name: INTERFACE_CLASS
field.doc: Named set of operations that characterize the behavior of an element.

field.name: UNION_CLASS
field.doc: Class describing a selection of one of the specified types.

field.name: META_CLASS
field.doc: Class whose instances are classes.

field.name: TYPE_CLASS
field.doc: Class used for specification of a domain of instances (objects), together with the operations applicable to the objects. A type may have attributes and associations.

field.name: CHARACTER_STRING
field.doc: Free text field.

field.name: INTEGER
field.doc: Numerical field.

field.name: ASSOCIATION
field.doc: Semantic relationship between two classes that involves connections among their instances.

class.doc: Datatype of element or entity.

interface.name: ExtendedElementInformation

method.name: getName
method.doc: Name of the extended metadata element.

method.name: getShortName
method.doc: Short form suitable for use in an implementation method such as XML or SGML. Returns null if the data type is code list element, in which case getDomainCode() may be used instead.

method.name: getDomainCode
method.doc: Three digit code assigned to the extended element. Returns a non-null value only if the data type is code list element, in which case getShortName() may be used instead.

method.name: getDefinition
method.doc: Definition of the extended element.

method.name: getObligation
method.doc: Obligation of the extended element.

method.name: getCondition
method.doc: Condition under which the extended element is mandatory. Returns a non-null value only if the obligation is conditional.

method.name: getDataType
method.doc: Code which identifies the kind of value provided in the extended element.

method.name: getMaximumOccurrence
method.doc: Maximum occurrence of the extended element. Returns null if it doesn't apply, for example if the data type is enumeration, code list or code list element.

method.name: getDomainValue
method.doc: Valid values that can be assigned to the extended element. Returns null if it doesn't apply, for example if the data type is enumeration, code list or code list element.

method.name: getParentEntity
method.doc: Name of the metadata entity(s) under which this extended metadata element may appear. The name(s) may be standard metadata element(s) or other extended metadata element(s).

method.name: getRule
method.doc: Specifies how the extended element relates to other existing elements and entities.

method.name: getRationales
method.doc: Reason for creating the extended element.

method.name: getSources
method.doc: Name of the person or organization creating the extended element.

interface.doc: New metadata element, not found in ISO 19115, which is required to describe geographic data.

interface.name: FeatureTypeList

method.name: getSpatialObject
method.doc: Instance of a type defined in the spatial schema.

method.name: getSpatialSchemaName
method.doc: Name of the spatial schema used.

interface.doc: List of names of feature types with the same spatial representation (same as spatial attributes).

interface.name: Identifier

method.name: getCode
method.doc: Alphanumeric value identifying an instance in the namespace.

method.name: getAuthority
method.doc: Organization or party responsible for definition and maintenance of the code.

field.name: CODE_KEY
field.doc: Key for the {@value} property to be given to the CRS factory createFoo(…) methods. This is used for setting the value to be returned by getCode().

field.name: AUTHORITY_KEY
field.doc: Key for the {@value} property to be given to the CRS factory createFoo(…) methods. This is used for setting the value to be returned by getAuthority().

interface.doc: Value uniquely identifying an object within a namespace.

interface.name: Metadata

method.name: getFileIdentifier
method.doc: Unique identifier for this metadata file, or null if none.

method.name: getLanguage
method.doc: Language used for documenting metadata.

method.name: getCharacterSet
method.doc: Full name of the character coding standard used for the metadata set.

method.name: getParentIdentifier

method.name: getHierarchyLevels
method.doc: Scope to which the metadata applies.

method.name: getHierarchyLevelNames
method.doc: Name of the hierarchy levels for which the metadata is provided.

method.name: getContacts
method.doc: Parties responsible for the metadata information.

method.name: getDateStamp
method.doc:
Date that the metadata was created.
Warning: The return type of this method may change in GeoAPI 3.1 release. It may be replaced by a type matching more closely either ISO 19108 (Temporal Schema) or ISO 19103.

method.name: getMetadataStandardName
method.doc: Name of the metadata standard (including profile name) used.

method.name: getMetadataStandardVersion
method.doc: Version (profile) of the metadata standard used.

method.name: getDataSetUri
method.doc: Uniformed Resource Identifier (URI) of the dataset to which the metadata applies.

method.name: getLocales
method.doc: Provides information about an alternatively used localized character string for a linguistic extension.

method.name: getSpatialRepresentationInfo
method.doc: Digital representation of spatial information in the dataset.

method.name: getReferenceSystemInfo
method.doc: Description of the spatial and temporal reference systems used in the dataset.

method.name: getMetadataExtensionInfo
method.doc: Information describing metadata extensions.

method.name: getIdentificationInfo
method.doc: Basic information about the resource(s) to which the metadata applies.

method.name: getContentInfo
method.doc: Provides information about the feature catalogue and describes the coverage and image data characteristics.

method.name: getDistributionInfo
method.doc: Provides information about the distributor of and options for obtaining the resource(s).

method.name: getDataQualityInfo
method.doc: Provides overall assessment of quality of a resource(s).

method.name: getPortrayalCatalogueInfo
method.doc: Provides information about the catalogue of rules defined for the portrayal of a resource(s).

method.name: getMetadataConstraints
method.doc: Provides restrictions on the access and use of data.

method.name: getApplicationSchemaInfo
method.doc: Provides information about the conceptual schema of a dataset.

method.name: getMetadataMaintenance
method.doc: Provides information about the frequency of metadata updates, and the scope of those updates.

method.name: getAcquisitionInformation
method.doc: Provides information about the acquisition of the data.

interface.doc: Root entity which defines metadata about a resource or resources.

interface.name: MetadataExtensionInformation

method.name: getExtensionOnLineResource
method.doc: Information about on-line sources containing the community profile name and the extended metadata elements. Information for all new metadata elements.

method.name: getExtendedElementInformation
method.doc: Provides information about a new metadata element, not found in ISO 19115, which is required to describe geographic data.

interface.doc: Information describing metadata extensions.

interface.name: EnvironmentalRecord

method.name: getAverageAirTemperature
method.doc:
Average air temperature along the flight pass during the photo flight.
Warning: The return type of this method may change in GeoAPI 3.1. It may be replaced by the Temperature type in order to provide unit of measurement together with the value.

method.name: getMaxRelativeHumidity
method.doc:
Maximum relative humidity along the flight pass during the photo flight.
Warning: The return type of this method may change in GeoAPI 3.1. It may be replaced by the Dimensionless type in order to provide unit of measurement (typically a percentage) together with the value.

method.name: getMaxAltitude
method.doc:
Maximum altitude during the photo flight.
Warning: The return type of this method may change in GeoAPI 3.1. It may be replaced by the Length type in order to provide unit of measurement together with the value.

method.name: getMeteorologicalConditions
method.doc: Meteorological conditions in the photo flight area, in particular clouds, snow and wind.

method.name: getSeries
method.doc: Information about the series, or aggregate dataset, of which the dataset is a part. Returns null if none.

method.name: getOtherCitationDetails
method.doc: Other information required to complete the citation that is not recorded elsewhere. Returns null if none.

method.name: getCollectiveTitle
method.doc: Common title with holdings note. Note: title identifies elements of a series collectively, combined with information about what volumes are available at the source cited. Returns null if there is no title.

method.name: getISBN
method.doc: International Standard Book Number, or null if none.

method.name: getISSN
method.doc: International Standard Serial Number, or null if none.

interface.doc: Standardized resource reference.

interface.name: CitationDate

method.name: getDate
method.doc:
Reference date for the cited resource.
Warning: The return type of this method may change in GeoAPI 3.1 release. It may be replaced by a type matching more closely either ISO 19108 (Temporal Schema) or ISO 19103.

method.name: getDateType
method.doc: Event used for reference date.

interface.doc: Reference date and event used to describe it.

interface.name: Contact

method.name: getPhone
method.doc: Telephone numbers at which the organization or individual may be contacted. Returns null if none.

method.name: getAddress
method.doc: Physical and email address at which the organization or individual may be contacted. Returns null if none.

method.name: getOnlineResource
method.doc: On-line information that can be used to contact the individual or organization. Returns null if none.

method.name: getHoursOfService
method.doc: Time period (including time zone) when individuals can contact the organization or individual. Returns null if unspecified.

method.name: getContactInstructions
method.doc: Supplemental instructions on how or when to contact the individual or organization. Returns null if none.

interface.doc: Information required to enable contact with the responsible person and/or organization.

class.name: DateType

method.name: values

method.name: valueOf

field.name: CREATION
field.doc: Date identifies when the resource was brought into existence.

field.name: PUBLICATION
field.doc: Date identifies when the resource was issued.

field.name: REVISION
field.doc: Date identifies when the resource was examined or re-examined and improved or amended.

class.doc: Identification of when a given event occurred

class.name: OnLineFunction

method.name: values
method.doc: Returns the list of OnLineFunctions.

method.name: family

method.name: valueOf
method.doc: Returns the on line function that matches the given string, or returns a new one if none match it.

field.name: DOWNLOAD
field.doc: Online instructions for transferring data from one storage device or system to another.

field.name: INFORMATION
field.doc: Online information about the resource.

field.name: OFFLINE_ACCESS
field.doc: Online instructions for requesting the resource from the provider.

field.name: ORDER
field.doc: Online order process for obtaining the resource.

field.name: SEARCH
field.doc: Online search interface for seeking out information about the resource.

class.doc: Class of information to which the referencing entity applies.

interface.name: OnlineResource

method.name: getLinkage
method.doc: Location (address) for on-line access using a Uniform Resource Locator address or similar addressing scheme such as "http://www.statkart.no/isotc211".

method.name: getProtocol
method.doc: Connection protocol to be used. Returns null if none.

method.name: getApplicationProfile
method.doc: Name of an application profile that can be used with the online resource. Returns null if none.

method.name: getName
method.doc: Name of the online resource. Returns null if none.

method.name: getDescription
method.doc: Detailed text description of what the online resource is/does. Returns null if none.

method.name: getFunction
method.doc: Code for function performed by the online resource. Returns null if unspecified.

interface.doc: Information about on-line sources from which the dataset, specification, or community profile name and extended metadata elements can be obtained.

class.name: PresentationForm

method.name: values
method.doc: Returns the list of PresentationForms.

method.name: family
method.doc: Returns the list of enumerations of the same kind than this enum.

method.name: valueOf
method.doc: Returns the presentation form that matches the given string, or returns a new one if none match it.

field.name: DOCUMENT_DIGITAL
field.doc: Digital representation of a primarily textual item (can contain illustrations also).

field.name: DOCUMENT_HARDCOPY
field.doc: Representation of a primarily textual item (can contain illustrations also) on paper, photographic material, or other media.

field.name: IMAGE_DIGITAL
field.doc: Likeness of natural or man-made features, objects, and activities acquired through the sensing of visual or any other segment of the electromagnetic spectrum by sensors, such as thermal infrared, and high resolution radar and stored in digital format.

field.name: IMAGE_HARDCOPY
field.doc: Likeness of natural or man-made features, objects, and activities acquired through the sensing of visual or any other segment of the electromagnetic spectrum by sensors, such as thermal infrared, and high resolution radar and reproduced on paper, photographic material, or other media for use directly by the human user.

field.name: MAP_DIGITAL
field.doc: Map represented in raster or vector form.

field.name: MAP_HARDCOPY
field.doc: Map printed on paper, photographic material, or other media for use directly by the human user.

field.name: MODEL_DIGITAL
field.doc: Multi-dimensional digital representation of a feature, process, etc.

field.name: MODEL_HARDCOPY
field.doc: 3-dimensional, physical model.

field.name: PROFILE_DIGITAL
field.doc: Vertical cross-section in digital form.

field.name: PROFILE_HARDCOPY
field.doc: Vertical cross-section printed on paper, etc.

field.name: TABLE_DIGITAL
field.doc: Digital representation of facts or figures systematically displayed, especially in columns.

field.name: TABLE_HARDCOPY
field.doc: Representation of facts or figures systematically displayed, especially in columns, printed on paper, photographic material, or other media.

field.name: VIDEO_DIGITAL
field.doc: Digital video recording.

field.name: VIDEO_HARDCOPY
field.doc: Video recording on film.

class.doc: Mode in which the data is represented.

interface.name: ResponsibleParty

method.name: getIndividualName
method.doc: Name of the responsible person- surname, given name, title separated by a delimiter. Only one of individualName, organisationName and positionName shall be provided.

method.name: getOrganisationName
method.doc: Name of the responsible organization. Only one of individualName, organisationName and positionName shall be provided.

method.name: getPositionName
method.doc: Role or position of the responsible person. Only one of individualName, organisationName and positionName shall be provided.

method.name: getContactInfo
method.doc: Address of the responsible party.

method.name: getRole
method.doc: Function performed by the responsible party.

interface.doc: Identification of, and means of communication with, person(s) and organizations associated with the dataset.

class.name: Role

method.name: values
method.doc: Returns the list of Roles.

method.name: family
method.doc: Returns the list of enumerations of the same kind than this enum.

method.name: valueOf
method.doc: Returns the role that matches the given string, or returns a new one if none match it.

field.name: RESOURCE_PROVIDER
field.doc: Party that supplies the resource.

field.name: CUSTODIAN
field.doc: Party that accepts accountability and responsibility for the data and ensures appropriate care and maintenance of the resource.

field.name: OWNER
field.doc: Party that owns the resource.

field.name: USER
field.doc: Party who uses the resource.

field.name: DISTRIBUTOR
field.doc: Party who distributes the resource.

field.name: ORIGINATOR
field.doc: Party who created the resource.

field.name: POINT_OF_CONTACT
field.doc: Party who can be contacted for acquiring knowledge about or acquisition of the resource.

field.name: PRINCIPAL_INVESTIGATOR
field.doc: Key party responsible for gathering information and conducting research.

field.name: PROCESSOR
field.doc: Party who has processed the data in a manner such that the resource has been modified.

field.name: PUBLISHER
field.doc: Party who published the resource.

field.name: AUTHOR
field.doc: Party who authored the resource.

class.doc: Function performed by the responsible party.

interface.name: Series

method.name: getName
method.doc: Name of the series, or aggregate dataset, of which the dataset is a part. Returns null if none.

method.name: getIssueIdentification
method.doc: Information identifying the issue of the series.

method.name: getPage
method.doc: Details on which pages of the publication the article was published.

interface.doc: Information about the series, or aggregate dataset, to which a dataset belongs.

interface.name: Telephone

method.name: getVoices
method.doc: Telephone numbers by which individuals can speak to the responsible organization or individual.

method.name: getFacsimiles
method.doc: Telephone numbers of a facsimile machine for the responsible organization or individual.

interface.doc: Telephone numbers for contacting the responsible individual or organization.

class.name: Classification

method.name: valueOf

field.name: UNCLASSIFIED
field.doc: Available for general disclosure.

field.name: RESTRICTED
field.doc: Not for general disclosure.

field.name: CONFIDENTIAL
field.doc: Available for someone who can be entrusted with information.

field.name: SECRET
field.doc: Kept or meant to be kept private, unknown, or hidden from all but a select group of people.

field.name: TOP_SECRET
field.doc: Of the highest secrecy.

class.doc: Name of the handling restrictions on the dataset.

interface.name: Constraints

method.name: getUseLimitations
method.doc: Limitation affecting the fitness for use of the resource. Example: "not to be used for navigation".

interface.doc: Restrictions on the access and use of a resource or metadata.

interface.name: LegalConstraints

method.name: getAccessConstraints
method.doc: Access constraints applied to assure the protection of privacy or intellectual property, and any special restrictions or limitations on obtaining the resource.

method.name: getUseConstraints
method.doc: Constraints applied to assure the protection of privacy or intellectual property, and any special restrictions or limitations or warnings on using the resource.

method.name: getOtherConstraints
method.doc: Other restrictions and legal prerequisites for accessing and using the resource. This method should returns a non-empty value only if access constraints or use constraints declares other restrictions.

interface.doc: Restrictions and legal prerequisites for accessing and using the resource.

class.name: Restriction

method.name: values
method.doc: Returns the list of Restrictions.

method.name: family
method.doc: Returns the list of enumerations of the same kind than this enum.

method.name: valueOf
method.doc: Returns the restriction that matches the given string, or returns a new one if none match it.

field.name: COPYRIGHT
field.doc: Exclusive right to the publication, production, or sale of the rights to a literary, dramatic, musical, or artistic work, or to the use of a commercial print or label, granted by law for a specified period of time to an author, composer, artist, distributor.

field.name: PATENT
field.doc: Government has granted exclusive right to make, sell, use or license an invention or discovery.

field.name: PATENT_PENDING
field.doc: Produced or sold information awaiting a patent.

field.name: TRADEMARK
field.doc: A name, symbol, or other device identifying a product, officially registered and legally restricted to the use of the owner or manufacturer.

field.name: LICENSE
field.doc: Formal permission to do something.

field.name: INTELLECTUAL_PROPERTY_RIGHTS
field.doc: Rights to financial benefit from and control of distribution of non-tangible property that is a result of creativity.

field.name: RESTRICTED
field.doc: Withheld from general circulation or disclosure.

field.name: OTHER_RESTRICTIONS
field.doc: Limitation not listed.

class.doc: Limitation(s) placed upon the access or use of the data.

interface.name: SecurityConstraints

method.name: getClassification
method.doc: Name of the handling restrictions on the resource.

method.name: getUserNote
method.doc: Explanation of the application of the legal constraints or other restrictions and legal prerequisites for obtaining and using the resource.

method.name: getClassificationSystem
method.doc: Name of the classification system.

method.name: getHandlingDescription
method.doc: Additional information about the restrictions on handling the resource.

interface.doc: Handling restrictions imposed on the resource for national security or similar security concerns.

interface.name: Band

method.name: getMaxValue
method.doc: Longest wavelength that the sensor is capable of collecting within a designated band. Returns null if unspecified.

method.name: getMinValue
method.doc: Shortest wavelength that the sensor is capable of collecting within a designated band. Returns null if unspecified.

method.name: getPeakResponse
method.doc: Wavelength at which the response is the highest. Returns null if unspecified.

method.name: getUnits
method.doc: Units in which sensor wavelengths are expressed.

method.name: getBitsPerValue
method.doc: Maximum number of significant bits in the uncompressed representation for the value in each band of each pixel. Returns null if unspecified.

method.name: getToneGradation
method.doc: Number of discrete numerical values in the grid data. Returns null if unspecified.

method.name: getScaleFactor
method.doc: Scale factor which has been applied to the cell value. Returns null if unspecified.

method.name: getOffset
method.doc: The physical value corresponding to a cell value of zero. Returns null if unspecified.

method.name: getBandBoundaryDefinition
method.doc: Designation of criterion for defining maximum and minimum wavelengths for a spectral band.

method.name: getNominalSpatialResolution
method.doc:
Smallest distance between which separate points can be distinguished, as specified in instrument design.
Warning: The return type of this method may change in GeoAPI 3.1. It may be replaced by the Length type in order to provide unit of measurement together with the value.

method.name: getTransferFunctionType
method.doc: Type of transfer function to be used when scaling a physical value for a given element.

method.name: getTransmittedPolarization
method.doc: Polarization of the radiation transmitted.

method.name: getDetectedPolarization
method.doc: Polarization of the radiation detected.

interface.doc: Range of wavelengths in the electromagnetic spectrum.

class.name: BandDefinition

method.name: values
method.doc: Returns the list of BandDefinitions.

method.name: family
method.doc: Returns the list of enumerations of the same kind than this enum.

method.name: valueOf
method.doc: Returns the band definition that matches the given string, or returns a new one if none match it.

field.name: THREE_DB
field.doc: Width of a distribution equal to the distance between the outer two points on the distribution having power level half of that at the peak.

field.name: HALF_MAXIMUM
field.doc: Width of a distribution equal to the distance between the outer two points on the distribution having power level half of that at the peak.

field.name: FIFTY_PERCENT
field.doc: Full spectral width of a spectral power density measured at 50% of its peak height.

field.name: ONE_OVER_E
field.doc: Width of a distribution equal to the distance between the outer two points on the distribution having power level 1/e that of the peak.

field.name: EQUIVALENT_WIDTH
field.doc: Width of a band with full sensitivity or absorption at every wavelength that detects or absorbs the same amount of energy as the band described.

class.doc: Designation of criterion for defining maximum and minimum wavelengths for a spectral band.

interface.name: ContentInformation
interface.doc: Description of the content of a dataset.

method.name: values
method.doc: Returns the list of CoverageContentTypes.

method.name: family
method.doc: Returns the list of enumerations of the same kind than this enum.

method.name: valueOf
method.doc: Returns the coverage content type that matches the given string, or returns a new one if none match it.

field.name: IMAGE
field.doc: Meaningful numerical representation of a physical parameter that is not the actual value of the physical parameter.

field.name: THEMATIC_CLASSIFICATION
field.doc: Code value with no quantitative meaning, used to represent a physical quantity.

field.name: PHYSICAL_MEASUREMENT
field.doc: Value in physical units of the quantity being measured.

class.doc: Specific type of information represented in the cell.

interface.name: CoverageDescription

method.name: getAttributeDescription
method.doc: Description of the attribute described by the measurement value.

method.name: getContentType
method.doc: Type of information represented by the cell value.

method.name: getDimensions
method.doc: Information on the dimensions of the cell measurement value.

method.name: getRangeElementDescriptions
method.doc: Provides the description of the specific range elements of a coverage.

interface.doc: Information about the content of a grid data cell.

interface.name: FeatureCatalogueDescription

method.name: isCompliant
method.doc: Indication of whether or not the cited feature catalogue complies with ISO 19110. This value is optional, and therefore may be null.

method.name: getLanguages
method.doc: Language(s) used within the catalogue.

method.name: isIncludedWithDataset
method.doc: Indication of whether or not the feature catalogue is included with the dataset.

method.name: getFeatureTypes
method.doc: Subset of feature types from cited feature catalogue occurring in dataset.

method.name: getFeatureCatalogueCitations
method.doc: Complete bibliographic reference to one or more external feature catalogues.

interface.doc: Information identifying the feature catalogue.

interface.name: ImageDescription

method.name: getIlluminationElevationAngle
method.doc: Illumination elevation measured in degrees clockwise from the target plane at intersection of the optical line of sight with the Earth's surface. For images from a scanning device, refer to the centre pixel of the image.

method.name: getIlluminationAzimuthAngle
method.doc: Illumination azimuth measured in degrees clockwise from true north at the time the image is taken. For images from a scanning device, refer to the centre pixel of the image.

method.name: getImagingCondition
method.doc: Conditions affected the image.

method.name: getImageQualityCode
method.doc: Specifies the image quality.

method.name: getCloudCoverPercentage
method.doc: Area of the dataset obscured by clouds, expressed as a percentage of the spatial extent.

method.name: getProcessingLevelCode
method.doc: Image distributor's code that identifies the level of radiometric and geometric processing that has been applied.

method.name: getCompressionGenerationQuantity
method.doc: Count of the number of lossy compression cycles performed on the image. Returns null if the information is not provided.

method.name: getTriangulationIndicator
method.doc: Indication of whether or not triangulation has been performed upon the image. Returns null if the information is not provided.

method.name: isRadiometricCalibrationDataAvailable
method.doc: Indication of whether or not the radiometric calibration information for generating the radiometrically calibrated standard data product is available.

method.name: isCameraCalibrationInformationAvailable
method.doc: Indication of whether or not constants are available which allow for camera calibration corrections.

method.name: isFilmDistortionInformationAvailable
method.doc: Indication of whether or not Calibration Reseau information is available.

method.name: isLensDistortionInformationAvailable
method.doc: Indication of whether or not lens aberration correction information is available.

interface.doc: Information about an image's suitability for use.

field.name: BLURRED_IMAGE
field.doc: Portion of the image is blurred.

field.name: CLOUD
field.doc: Portion of the image is partially obscured by cloud cover

field.name: DEGRADING_OBLIQUITY
field.doc: Acute angle between the plane of the ecliptic (the plane of the Earth's orbit) and the plane of the celestial equator.

field.name: FOG
field.doc: Portion of the image is partially obscured by fog.

field.name: HEAVY_SMOKE_OR_DUST
field.doc: Portion of the image is partially obscured by heavy smoke or dust.

field.name: NIGHT
field.doc: Image was taken at night.

field.name: RAIN
field.doc: Image was taken during rainfall.

field.name: SEMI_DARKNESS
field.doc: Image was taken during semi-dark conditions or twilight conditions.

field.name: SHADOW
field.doc: Portion of the image is obscured by shadow.

field.name: SNOW
field.doc: Portion of the image is obscured by snow.

field.name: TERRAIN_MASKING
field.doc: The absence of collection data of a given point or area caused by the relative location of topographic features which obstruct the collection path between the collector(s) and the subject(s) of interest.

class.doc: Code which indicates conditions which may affect the image.

class.name: PolarizationOrientation

method.name: values
method.doc: Returns the list of PolarizationOrientations.

method.name: family
method.doc: Returns the list of enumerations of the same kind than this enum.

method.name: valueOf
method.doc: Returns the transfer function type that matches the given string, or returns a new one if none match it.

field.name: HORIZONTAL
field.doc: Polarization of the sensor oriented in the horizontal plane in relation to swath direction.

field.name: VERTICAL
field.doc: Polarization of the sensor oriented in the vertical plane in relation to swath direction.

field.name: LEFT_CIRCULAR
field.doc: Polarization of the sensor oriented in the left circular plane in relation to swath direction.

field.name: RIGHT_CIRCULAR
field.doc: Polarization of the sensor oriented in the right circular plane in relation to swath direction.

field.name: THETA
field.doc: Polarization of the sensor oriented in the angle between +90 # and 0 # parallel to swath direction.

field.name: PHI
field.doc: Polarization of the sensor oriented in the +90 # and 0 # perpendicular to swath direction.

class.doc: Polarization of the antenna relative to the waveform.

method.doc: Description of a set of specific range elements.

method.doc: Provides the list of feature types concerned by the transfer data file. Depending on the transfer choices, a data file may contain data related to one or many feature types. This attribute may be omitted when the dataset is composed of a single file and/or the data does not relate to a feature catalogue.

method.name: getOffLine
method.doc: Information about offline media on which the resource can be obtained.

method.name: getDistributorFormats

field.name: SATELLITE
