field.name: TELEPHONE_LINK
field.doc: Communication through a telephone network.

field.name: HARDCOPY
field.doc: Pamphlet or leaflet giving descriptive information.

class.doc: Name of the medium.

interface.name: StandardOrderProcess

method.name: getFees
method.doc: Fees and terms for retrieving the resource. Include monetary units (as specified in ISO 4217).

method.name: getPlannedAvailableDateTime
method.doc:
Date and time when the dataset will be available.
Warning: The return type of this method may change in GeoAPI 3.1 release. It may be replaced by a type matching more closely either ISO 19108 (Temporal Schema) or ISO 19103.

method.name: getOrderingInstructions
method.doc: General instructions, terms and services provided by the distributor.

method.name: getTurnaround
method.doc: Typical turnaround time for the filling of an order.

interface.doc: Common ways in which the resource may be obtained or received, and related instructions and fee information.

interface.name: BoundingPolygon

method.name: getPolygons
method.doc: Returns the sets of points defining the bounding polygon.

interface.doc: Boundary enclosing the dataset, expressed as the closed set of (x,y) coordinates of the polygon. The last point replicates first point.

interface.name: Extent

method.name: getDescription
method.doc: Returns the spatial and temporal extent for the referring object.

method.name: getGeographicElements
method.doc: Provides geographic component of the extent of the referring object

method.name: getTemporalElements
method.doc: Provides temporal component of the extent of the referring object

method.name: getVerticalElements
method.doc: Provides vertical component of the extent of the referring object

interface.doc: Information about spatial, vertical, and temporal extent. This interface has four optional attributes (geographic elements, temporal elements, and vertical elements) and an element called description. At least one of the four shall be used.

interface.name: GeographicBoundingBox

method.name: getWestBoundLongitude
method.doc: Returns the western-most coordinate of the limit of the dataset extent. The value is expressed in longitude in decimal degrees (positive east).

method.name: getEastBoundLongitude
method.doc: Returns the eastern-most coordinate of the limit of the dataset extent. The value is expressed in longitude in decimal degrees (positive east).

method.name: getSouthBoundLatitude
method.doc: Returns the southern-most coordinate of the limit of the dataset extent. The value is expressed in latitude in decimal degrees (positive north).

method.name: getNorthBoundLatitude
method.doc: Returns the northern-most, coordinate of the limit of the dataset extent. The value is expressed in latitude in decimal degrees (positive north).

interface.doc: Geographic position of the dataset. This is only an approximate so specifying the co-ordinate reference system is unnecessary.

interface.name: GeographicDescription

method.name: getGeographicIdentifier
method.doc: Returns the identifier used to represent a geographic area.

interface.doc: Description of the geographic area using identifiers.

interface.name: GeographicExtent

method.name: getInclusion
method.doc: Indication of whether the bounding polygon encompasses an area covered by the data (inclusion) or an area where data is not present (exclusion).

interface.doc: Base interface for geographic area of the dataset.

interface.name: SpatialTemporalExtent

method.name: getSpatialExtent
method.doc: Returns the spatial extent component of composite spatial and temporal extent.

interface.doc: Extent with respect to date/time and spatial boundaries.

interface.name: TemporalExtent

method.name: getExtent
method.doc: Returns the date and time for the content of the dataset.

interface.doc: Time period covered by the content of the dataset.

interface.name: VerticalExtent

method.name: getMinimumValue
method.doc: Returns the lowest vertical extent contained in the dataset.

method.name: getMaximumValue
method.doc: Returns the highest vertical extent contained in the dataset.

method.name: getVerticalCRS
method.doc: Provides information about the vertical coordinate reference system to which the maximum and minimum elevation values are measured. The CRS identification includes unit of measure.

interface.doc: Vertical domain of dataset.

interface.name: AggregateInformation

method.name: getAggregateDataSetName
method.doc: Citation information about the aggregate dataset.

method.name: getAggregateDataSetIdentifier
method.doc: Identification information about aggregate dataset.

method.name: getAssociationType
method.doc: Association type of the aggregate dataset.

method.name: getInitiativeType
method.doc: Type of initiative under which the aggregate dataset was produced.

interface.doc: Aggregate dataset information.

class.name: AssociationType

method.name: values
method.doc: Returns the list of AssociationTypes.

method.name: family
method.doc: Returns the list of enumerations of the same kind than this enum.

method.name: valueOf
method.doc: Returns the association type that matches the given string, or returns a new one if none match it.

field.name: CROSS_REFERENCE
field.doc: Reference from one dataset to another.

field.name: LARGER_WORD_CITATION
field.doc: Reference to a master dataset of which this one is a part.

field.name: PART_OF_SEAMLESS_DATABASE
field.doc: Part of same structured set of data held in a computer.

field.name: SOURCE
field.doc: Mapping and charting information from which the dataset content originates.

field.name: STEREO_MATE
field.doc: Part of a set of imagery that when used together, provides three-dimensional images.

class.doc: Justification for the correlation of two datasets.

interface.name: BrowseGraphic

method.name: getFileName
method.doc: Name of the file that contains a graphic that provides an illustration of the dataset.

method.name: getFileDescription
method.doc: Text description of the illustration.

method.name: getFileType
method.doc: Format in which the illustration is encoded. Examples: CGM, EPS, GIF, JPEG, PBM, PS, TIFF, XWD. Raster formats are encouraged to use one of the names returned by getReaderFormatNames().

interface.doc: Graphic that provides an illustration of the dataset (should include a legend for the graphic).

class.name: CharacterSet

method.name: toCharset
method.doc: Converts the Character Set to a java Charset, if it can.

method.name: names
method.doc: Returns all the names of this code. The returned array contains the following elements, with duplicated values and null values removed: The programmatic name The UML identifier The charset name Those names are typically equal except for the case (programmatic names are upper case while UML names are lower case) and special characters like '-'.

method.name: values
method.doc: Returns the list of CharacterSets.

method.name: family
method.doc: Returns the list of enumerations of the same kind than this enum.

method.name: valueOf
method.doc: Returns the character set that matches the given string, or returns a new one if none match it.

field.name: UCS_2
field.doc: 16-bit fixed size Universal Character Set, based on ISO/IEC 10646.

field.name: UCS_4
field.doc: 32-bit fixed size Universal Character Set, based on ISO/IEC 10646.

field.name: UTF_7
field.doc: 7-bit variable size UCS Transfer Format, based on ISO/IEC 10646.

field.name: UTF_8
field.doc: 8-bit variable size UCS Transfer Format, based on ISO/IEC 10646.

field.name: UTF_16
field.doc: 16-bit variable size UCS Transfer Format, based on ISO/IEC 10646.

field.name: ISO_8859_1
field.doc: ISO/IEC 8859-1, Information technology. 8-bit single-byte coded graphic character sets - Part 1: Latin alphabet No. 1.

field.name: ISO_8859_2
field.doc: ISO/IEC 8859-2, Information technology. 8-bit single-byte coded graphic character sets - Part 2: Latin alphabet No. 2.

field.name: ISO_8859_3
field.doc: ISO/IEC 8859-3, Information technology. 8-bit single-byte coded graphic character sets - Part 3: Latin alphabet No. 3.

field.name: ISO_8859_4
field.doc: ISO/IEC 8859-4, Information technology. 8-bit single-byte coded graphic character sets - Part 4: Latin alphabet No. 4.

field.name: ISO_8859_5
field.doc: ISO/IEC 8859-5, Information technology. 8-bit single-byte coded graphic character sets - Part 5: Latin/Cyrillic alphabet.

field.name: ISO_8859_6
field.doc: ISO/IEC 8859-6, Information technology. 8-bit single-byte coded graphic character sets - Part 6: Latin/Arabic alphabet.

field.name: ISO_8859_7
field.doc: ISO/IEC 8859-7, Information technology. 8-bit single-byte coded graphic character sets - Part 7: Latin/Greek alphabet.

field.name: ISO_8859_8
field.doc: ISO/IEC 8859-8, Information technology. 8-bit single-byte coded graphic character sets - Part 8: Latin/Hebrew alphabet.

field.name: ISO_8859_9
field.doc: ISO/IEC 8859-9, Information technology. 8-bit single-byte coded graphic character sets - Part 9: Latin alphabet No. 5.

field.name: ISO_8859_10
field.doc: ISO/IEC 8859-10, Information technology. 8-bit single-byte coded graphic character sets - Part 10: Latin alphabet No. 6.

field.name: ISO_8859_11
field.doc: ISO/IEC 8859-11, Information technology. 8-bit single-byte coded graphic character sets - Part 11: Latin/Thai alphabet.

field.name: ISO_8859_12
field.doc: A future ISO/IEC 8-bit single-byte coded graphic character set.

field.name: ISO_8859_13
field.doc: ISO/IEC 8859-13, Information technology. 8-bit single-byte coded graphic character sets - Part 13: Latin alphabet No. 7.

field.name: ISO_8859_14
field.doc: ISO/IEC 8859-14, Information technology. 8-bit single-byte coded graphic character sets - Part 14: Latin alphabet No. 8 (Celtic).

field.name: ISO_8859_15
field.doc: ISO/IEC 8859-15, Information technology. 8-bit single-byte coded graphic character sets - Part 15: Latin alphabet No. 9.

field.name: ISO_8859_16
field.doc: ISO/IEC 8859-16, Information technology. 8-bit single-byte coded graphic character sets - Part 16: Latin alphabet No. 10.

field.name: JIS
field.doc: Japanese code set used for electronic transmission.

field.name: SHIFT_JIS
field.doc: Japanese code set used on MS-DOS based machines.

field.name: EUC_JP
field.doc: Japanese code set used on UNIX based machines.

field.name: US_ASCII
field.doc: United States ASCII code set (ISO 646 US).

field.name: EBCDIC
field.doc: IBM mainframe code set.

field.name: EUC_KR
field.doc: Korean code set.

field.name: BIG_5
field.doc: Traditional Chinese code set used in Taiwan, Hong Kong, and other areas.

field.name: GB2312
field.doc: Simplified Chinese code set.

class.doc: Name of the character coding standard used for the resource.

interface.name: DataIdentification

method.name: getSpatialRepresentationTypes
method.doc: Method used to spatially represent geographic information.

method.name: getSpatialResolutions
method.doc: Factor which provides a general understanding of the density of spatial data in the dataset.

method.name: getLanguages
method.doc: Language(s) used within the dataset.

method.name: getCharacterSets
method.doc: Full name of the character coding standard(s) used for the dataset.

method.name: getTopicCategories
method.doc: Main theme(s) of the dataset.

method.name: getEnvironmentDescription
method.doc: Description of the dataset in the producer's processing environment, including items such as the software, the computer operating system, file name, and the dataset size.

method.name: getExtents
method.doc: Additional extent information including the bounding polygon, vertical, and temporal extent of the dataset.

method.name: getSupplementalInformation
method.doc: Any other descriptive information about the dataset.

interface.doc: Information required to identify a dataset.

interface.name: Identification

method.name: getCitation
method.doc: Citation data for the resource(s).

method.name: getAbstract
method.doc: Brief narrative summary of the content of the resource(s).

method.name: getPurpose
method.doc: Summary of the intentions with which the resource(s) was developed.

method.name: getCredits
method.doc: Recognition of those who contributed to the resource(s).

method.name: getStatus
method.doc: Status of the resource(s).

method.name: getPointOfContacts
method.doc: Identification of, and means of communication with, person(s) and organizations(s) associated with the resource(s).

method.name: getResourceMaintenances
method.doc: Provides information about the frequency of resource updates, and the scope of those updates.

method.name: getGraphicOverviews
method.doc: Provides a graphic that illustrates the resource(s) (should include a legend for the graphic).

method.name: getResourceFormats
method.doc: Provides a description of the format of the resource(s).

method.name: getDescriptiveKeywords
method.doc: Provides category keywords, their type, and reference source.

method.name: getResourceSpecificUsages
method.doc: Provides basic information about specific application(s) for which the resource(s) has/have been or is being used by different users.

method.name: getResourceConstraints
method.doc: Provides information about constraints which apply to the resource(s).

method.name: getAggregationInfo
method.doc: Provides aggregate dataset information.

interface.doc: Basic information required to uniquely identify a resource or resources.

class.name: InitiativeType

method.name: values
method.doc: Returns the list of InitiativeTypes.

method.name: family
method.doc: Returns the list of enumerations of the same kind than this enum.

method.name: valueOf
method.doc: Returns the initiative type that matches the given string, or returns a new one if none match it.

field.name: CAMPAIGN
field.doc: Series of organized planned actions.

field.name: COLLECTION
field.doc: Accumulation of datasets assembled for a specific purpose.

field.name: EXERCISE
field.doc: Specific performance of a function or group of functions.

field.name: EXPERIMENT
field.doc: Process designed to find if something is effective or valid.

field.name: INVESTIGATION
field.doc: Search or systematic inquiry.

field.name: MISSION
field.doc: Specific operation of a data collection system.

field.name: SENSOR
field.doc: Device or piece of equipment which detects or records.

field.name: OPERATION
field.doc: Action that is part of a series of actions.

field.name: PLATFORM
field.doc: Vehicle or other support base that holds a sensor.

field.name: PROCESS
field.doc: Method of doing something involving a number of steps.

field.name: PROGRAM
field.doc: Specific planned activity.

field.name: PROJECT
field.doc: Organized undertaking, research, or development.

field.name: STUDY
field.doc: Examination or investigation.

field.name: TASK
field.doc: Piece of work.

field.name: TRIAL
field.doc: Process of testing to discover or demonstrate something.

class.doc: Type of aggregation activity in which datasets are related

interface.name: Keywords

method.name: getKeywords
method.doc: Commonly used word(s) or formalised word(s) or phrase(s) used to describe the subject.

method.name: getType
method.doc: Subject matter used to group similar keywords.

method.name: getThesaurusName
method.doc: Name of the formally registered thesaurus or a similar authoritative source of keywords.

interface.doc: Keywords, their type and reference source.

class.name: KeywordType

method.name: values
method.doc: Returns the list of KeywordTypes.

method.name: family
method.doc: Returns the list of enumerations of the same kind than this enum.

method.name: valueOf
method.doc: Returns the KeywordType that matches the given string, or returns a new one if none match it.

field.name: DISCIPLINE
field.doc: Keyword identifies a branch of instruction or specialized learning.

field.name: PLACE
field.doc: Keyword identifies a location.

field.name: STRATUM
field.doc: Keyword identifies the layer(s) of any deposited substance.

field.name: TEMPORAL
field.doc: Keyword identifies a time period related to the dataset.

field.name: THEME
field.doc: Keyword identifies a particular subject or topic.

class.doc: Methods used to group similar keywords.

class.name: Progress

method.name: values
method.doc: Returns the list of Progresss.

method.name: family
method.doc: Returns the list of enumerations of the same kind than this enum.

method.name: valueOf
method.doc: Returns the progress that matches the given string, or returns a new one if none match it.

field.name: COMPLETED
field.doc: Production of the data has been completed.

field.name: HISTORICAL_ARCHIVE
field.doc: Data has been stored in an offline storage facility

field.name: OBSOLETE
field.doc: Data is no longer relevant.

field.name: ON_GOING
field.doc: Data is continually being updated.

field.name: PLANNED
field.doc: Fixed date has been established upon or by which the data will be created or updated.

field.name: REQUIRED
field.doc: Data needs to be generated or updated.

field.name: UNDER_DEVELOPMENT
field.doc: Data is currently in the process of being created.

class.doc: Status of the dataset or progress of a review.

interface.name: RepresentativeFraction

method.name: doubleValue
method.doc: Returns the scale value in a form usable for computation.

method.name: getDenominator
method.doc: The number below the line in a vulgar fraction.

method.name: equals
method.doc: Compares this representative fraction with the specified object for equality. RepresentativeFraction is a data object - equals is defined according to getDenominator(); Implementations should match the following:

method.name: hashCode
method.doc: Returns a hash value for this representative fraction. RepresentativeFraction is a data object - hashcode is defined according to getDenominator(). Implementations should match the following:

interface.doc: A scale defined as the inverse of a denominator. This is derived from ISO 19103 Scale where denominator = 1 / scale. Implementations are encouraged to extend Number in a manner equivalent to:

interface.name: Resolution

method.name: getEquivalentScale
method.doc: Level of detail expressed as the scale of a comparable hardcopy map or chart. Only one of equivalent scale and ground sample distance may be provided.

method.name: getDistance
method.doc:
Ground sample distance. Only one of equivalent scale and ground sample distance may be provided.
Warning: The return type of this method may change in GeoAPI 3.1. It may be replaced by the Length type in order to provide unit of measurement together with the value.

interface.doc: Level of detail expressed as a scale factor or a ground distance.

interface.name: ServiceIdentification
interface.doc: Identification of capabilities which a service provider makes available to a service user through a set of interfaces that define a behaviour - See ISO 19119 for further information. NOTE: The prefix was MD in a previous ISO 19115 specification, but has been renamed SV in corrigendum 2006.

class.name: TopicCategory

method.name: values
method.doc: Returns the list of TopicCategorys.

method.name: family
method.doc: Returns the list of enumerations of the same kind than this enum.

method.name: valueOf
method.doc: Returns the topic category that matches the given string, or returns a new one if none match it.

field.name: FARMING
field.doc: Rearing of animals and/or cultivation of plants. Examples: agriculture, irrigation, aquaculture, plantations, herding, pests and diseases affecting crops and livestock.

field.name: BIOTA
field.doc: Flora and/or fauna in natural environment. Examples: wildlife, vegetation, biological sciences, ecology, wilderness, sealife, wetlands, habitat

field.name: BOUNDARIES
field.doc: Legal land descriptions. Examples: political and administrative boundaries.

field.name: CLIMATOLOGY_METEOROLOGY_ATMOSPHERE
field.doc: Processes and phenomena of the atmosphere. Examples: cloud cover, weather, climate, atmospheric conditions, climate change, precipitation.

field.name: ECONOMY
field.doc: Economic activities, conditions and employment. Examples: production, labour, revenue, commerce, industry, tourism and ecotourism, forestry, fisheries, commercial or subsistence hunting, exploration and exploitation of resources such as minerals, oil and gas.

field.name: ELEVATION
field.doc: Height above or below sea level. Examples: altitude, bathymetry, digital elevation models, slope, derived products.

field.name: ENVIRONMENT
field.doc: Environmental resources, protection and conservation. Examples: environmental pollution, waste storage and treatment, environmental impact assessment, monitoring environmental risk, nature reserves, landscape.

field.name: GEOSCIENTIFIC_INFORMATION
field.doc: Information pertaining to earth sciences. Examples: geophysical features and processes, geology, minerals, sciences dealing with the composition, structure and origin of the earth's rocks, risks of earthquakes, volcanic activity, landslides, gravity information, soils, permafrost, hydrogeology, erosion.

field.name: HEALTH
field.doc: Health, health services, human ecology, and safety. Examples: disease and illness, factors affecting health, hygiene, substance abuse, mental and physical health, health services.

field.name: IMAGERY_BASE_MAPS_EARTH_COVER
field.doc: Base maps. Examples: land cover, topographic maps, imagery, unclassified images, annotations.

field.name: INTELLIGENCE_MILITARY
field.doc: Military bases, structures, activities. Examples: barracks, training grounds, military transportation, information collection.

field.name: INLAND_WATERS
field.doc: Inland water features, drainage systems and their characteristics. Examples: rivers and glaciers, salt lakes, water utilization plans, dams, currents, floods, water quality, hydrographic charts.

field.name: LOCATION
field.doc: Positional information and services. Examples: addresses, geodetic networks, control points, postal zones and services, place names.

field.name: OCEANS
field.doc: Features and characteristics of salt water bodies (excluding inland waters). Examples: tides, tidal waves, coastal information, reefs.

field.name: PLANNING_CADASTRE
field.doc: Information used for appropriate actions for future use of the land. Examples: land use maps, zoning maps, cadastral surveys, land ownership.

field.name: SOCIETY
field.doc: Characteristics of society and cultures. Examples: settlements, anthropology, archaeology, education, traditional beliefs, manners and customs, demographic data, recreational areas and activities, social impact assessments, crime and justice, census information

field.name: STRUCTURE
field.doc: Man-made construction. Examples: buildings, museums, churches, factories, housing, monuments, shops, towers.

field.name: TRANSPORTATION
field.doc: Means and aids for conveying persons and/or goods. Examples: roads, airports/airstrips, shipping routes, tunnels, nautical charts, vehicle or vessel location, aeronautical charts, railways.

field.name: UTILITIES_COMMUNICATION
field.doc: Energy, water and waste systems and communications infrastructure and services. Examples: hydroelectricity, geothermal, solar and nuclear sources of energy, water purification and distribution, sewage collection and disposal, electricity and gas distribution, data communication, telecommunication, radio, communication networks.

class.doc: High-level geographic data thematic classification to assist in the grouping and search of available geographic data sets. Can be used to group keywords as well. Listed examples are not exhaustive. is understood there are overlaps between general categories and the user is encouraged to select the one most appropriate.

interface.name: Usage

method.name: getSpecificUsage
method.doc: Brief description of the resource and/or resource series usage.

method.name: getUsageDate
method.doc:
Date and time of the first use or range of uses of the resource and/or resource series.
Warning: The return type of this method may change in GeoAPI 3.1 release. It may be replaced by a type matching more closely either ISO 19108 (Temporal Schema) or ISO 19103.

method.name: getUserDeterminedLimitations
method.doc: Applications, determined by the user for which the resource and/or resource series is not suitable.

method.name: getUserContactInfo
method.doc: Identification of and means of communicating with person(s) and organization(s) using the resource(s).

interface.doc: Brief description of ways in which the resource(s) is/are currently used.

interface.name: Algorithm

method.name: getCitation
method.doc: Information identifying the algorithm and version or date.

method.name: getDescription
method.doc: Information describing the algorithm used to generate the data.

interface.doc: Details of the methodology by which geographic information was derived from the instrument readings.

interface.name: Lineage

method.name: getStatement
method.doc: General explanation of the data producer's knowledge about the lineage of a dataset.

method.name: getProcessSteps
method.doc: Information about an event in the creation process for the data specified by the scope.

method.name: getSources
method.doc: Information about the source data used in creating the data specified by the scope.

interface.doc: Information about the events or source data used in constructing the data specified by the scope or lack of knowledge about lineage. Only one of statement, process steps and sources shall be provided.

interface.name: NominalResolution

method.name: getScanningResolution
method.doc:
Distance between consistent parts of (centre, left side, right side) adjacent pixels in the scan plane.
Warning: The return type of this method may change in GeoAPI 3.1. It may be replaced by the Length type in order to provide unit of measurement together with the value.

method.name: getGroundResolution
method.doc:
Distance between consistent parts of (centre, left side, right side) adjacent pixels in the object space.
Warning: The return type of this method may change in GeoAPI 3.1. It may be replaced by the Length type in order to provide unit of measurement together with the value.

interface.doc: Distance between consistent parts of (centre, left side, right side) adjacent pixels.

interface.name: Processing

method.name: getIdentifier
method.doc: Information to identify the processing package that produced the data.

method.name: getSoftwareReferences
method.doc: Reference to document describing processing software.

method.name: getProcedureDescription
method.doc: Additional details about the processing procedures.

method.name: getDocumentations
method.doc: Reference to documentation describing the processing.

method.name: getRunTimeParameters
method.doc: Parameters to control the processing operations, entered at run time.

method.name: getAlgorithms
method.doc: Details of the methodology by which geographic information was derived from the instrument readings.

interface.doc: Comprehensive information about the procedure(s), process(es) and algorithm(s) applied in the process step.

interface.name: ProcessStep

method.name: getDescription
method.doc: Description of the event, including related parameters or tolerances.

method.name: getRationale
method.doc: Requirement or purpose for the process step.

method.name: getDate
method.doc:
Date and time or range of date and time on or over which the process step occurred.
Warning: The return type of this method may change in GeoAPI 3.1 release. It may be replaced by a type matching more closely either ISO 19108 (Temporal Schema) or ISO 19103.

method.name: getProcessors
method.doc: Identification of, and means of communication with, person(s) and organization(s) associated with the process step.

method.name: getSources
method.doc: Information about the source data used in creating the data specified by the scope.

method.name: getOutputs
method.doc: Description of the product generated as a result of the process step.

method.name: getProcessingInformation
method.doc: Comprehensive information about the procedure by which the algorithm was applied to derive geographic data from the raw instrument measurements, such as datasets, software used, and the processing environment.

method.name: getReports
method.doc: Report generated by the process step.

interface.doc: Description of the event, including related parameters or tolerances.

interface.name: ProcessStepReport

method.name: getName
method.doc: Name of the processing report.

method.name: getDescription
method.doc: Textual description of what occurred during the process step.

method.name: getFileType
method.doc: Type of file that contains the processing report.

interface.doc: Report of what occurred during the process step.

interface.name: Source

method.name: getDescription
method.doc: Detailed description of the level of the source data.

method.name: getScaleDenominator
method.doc: Denominator of the representative fraction on a source map.

method.name: getSourceReferenceSystem
method.doc: Spatial reference system used by the source data.

method.name: getSourceCitation
method.doc: Recommended reference to be used for the source data.

method.name: getSourceExtents
method.doc: Information about the spatial, vertical and temporal extent of the source data.

method.name: getSourceSteps
method.doc: Information about an event in the creation process for the source data.

method.name: getProcessedLevel
method.doc: Processing level of the source data.

method.name: getResolution
method.doc: Distance between consistent parts (centre, left side, right side) of two adjacent pixels.

interface.doc: Information about the source data used in creating the data specified by the scope.

class.name: MaintenanceFrequency

method.name: values
method.doc: Returns the list of MaintenanceFrequencys.

method.name: family
method.doc: Returns the list of enumerations of the same kind than this enum.

method.name: valueOf
method.doc: Returns the maintenance frequency that matches the given string, or returns a new one if none match it.

field.name: CONTINUAL
field.doc: Data is repeatedly and frequently updated.

field.name: DAILY
field.doc: Data is updated each day.

field.name: WEEKLY
field.doc: Data is updated on a weekly basis.

field.name: FORTNIGHTLY
field.doc: Data is updated every two weeks.

field.name: MONTHLY
field.doc: Data is updated each month.

field.name: QUARTERLY
field.doc: Data is updated every three months.

field.name: BIANNUALLY
field.doc: Data is updated twice each year.

field.name: ANNUALLY
field.doc: Data is updated every year.

field.name: AS_NEEDED
field.doc: Data is updated as deemed necessary.

field.name: IRREGULAR
field.doc: Data is updated in intervals that are uneven in duration.

field.name: NOT_PLANNED
field.doc: There are no plans to update the data.

field.name: UNKNOWN
field.doc: Frequency of maintenance for the data is not known

field.name: UNKNOW
field.doc: @deprecated Renamed UNKNOWN.

class.doc: Frequency with which modifications and deletions are made to the data after it is first produced.

interface.name: MaintenanceInformation

method.name: getMaintenanceAndUpdateFrequency
method.doc: Frequency with which changes and additions are made to the resource after the initial resource is completed.

method.name: getDateOfNextUpdate
method.doc:
Scheduled revision date for resource.
Warning: The return type of this method may change in GeoAPI 3.1 release. It may be replaced by a type matching more closely either ISO 19108 (Temporal Schema) or ISO 19103.

method.name: getUserDefinedMaintenanceFrequency
method.doc: Maintenance period other than those defined.

method.name: getUpdateScopes
method.doc: Scope of data to which maintenance is applied.

method.name: getUpdateScopeDescriptions
method.doc: Additional information about the range or extent of the resource.

method.name: getMaintenanceNotes
method.doc: Information regarding specific requirements for maintaining the resource.

method.name: getContacts
method.doc: Identification of, and means of communicating with, person(s) and organization(s) with responsibility for maintaining the metadata.

interface.doc: Information about the scope and frequency of updating.

class.name: ScopeCode

method.name: values
method.doc: Returns the list of ScopeCodes.

method.name: family
method.doc: Returns the list of enumerations of the same kind than this enum.

method.name: valueOf
method.doc: Returns the scope code that matches the given string, or returns a new one if none match it.

field.name: ATTRIBUTE
field.doc: Information applies to the attribute value.

field.name: ATTRIBUTE_TYPE
field.doc: Information applies to the characteristic of a feature.

field.name: COLLECTION_HARDWARE
field.doc: Information applies to the collection hardware class.

field.name: COLLECTION_SESSION
field.doc: Information applies to the collection session.

field.name: DATASET
field.doc: Information applies to the dataset.

field.name: SERIES
field.doc: Information applies to the series. Note: "series" applies to any DS_Aggregate.

field.name: NON_GEOGRAPHIC_DATASET
field.doc: information applies to non-geographic data;

field.name: DIMENSION_GROUP
field.doc: Information applies to a dimension group.

field.name: FEATURE
field.doc: Information applies to a feature.

field.name: FEATURE_TYPE
field.doc: Information applies to a feature type.

field.name: PROPERTY_TYPE
field.doc: Information applies to a property type.

field.name: FIELD_SESSION
field.doc: Information applies to a field session.

field.name: SOFTWARE
field.doc: Information applies to a computer program or routine.

field.name: SERVICE
field.doc: Information applies to a capability which a service provider entity makes available to a service user entity through a set of interfaces that define a behaviour, such as a use case.

field.name: MODEL
field.doc: Information applies to a copy or imitation of an existing or hypothetical object.

field.name: TILE
field.doc: Information applies to a copy or imitation of an existing or hypothetical object.

class.doc: Class of information to which the referencing entity applies.

interface.name: ScopeDescription

method.name: getAttributes
method.doc: Attributes to which the information applies.

method.name: getFeatures
method.doc: Features to which the information applies.

method.name: getFeatureInstances
method.doc: Feature instances to which the information applies.

method.name: getAttributeInstances
method.doc: Attribute instances to which the information applies.

method.name: getDataset
method.doc: Dataset to which the information applies.

method.name: getOther
method.doc: Class of information that does not fall into the other categories to which the information applies.

interface.doc: Description of the class of information covered by the information.

interface.name: AbsoluteExternalPositionalAccuracy
interface.doc: Closeness of reported coordinate values to values accepted as or being true.

interface.name: AccuracyOfATimeMeasurement
interface.doc: Correctness of the temporal references of an item (reporting of error in time measurement).

interface.name: Completeness
interface.doc: Presence and absence of features, their attributes and their relationships.

interface.name: CompletenessCommission
interface.doc: Excess data present in the dataset, as described by the scope.

interface.name: CompletenessOmission
interface.doc: Data absent from the dataset, as described by the scope.

interface.name: ConceptualConsistency
interface.doc: Adherence to rules of the conceptual schema.

interface.name: ConformanceResult

method.name: getSpecification
method.doc: Citation of product specification or user requirement against which data is being evaluated.

method.name: getExplanation
method.doc: Explanation of the meaning of conformance for this result.

method.name: pass
method.doc: Indication of the conformance result.

interface.doc: Information about the outcome of evaluating the obtained value (or set of values) against a specified acceptable conformance quality level.

interface.name: CoverageResult

method.name: getSpatialRepresentationType
method.doc: Method used to spatially represent the coverage result.

method.name: getResultSpatialRepresentation
method.doc: Provides the digital representation of data quality measures composing the coverage result.

method.name: getResultContentDescription
method.doc: Provides the description of the content of the result coverage, i.e. semantic definition of the data quality measures.

method.name: getResultFormat
method.doc: Provides information about the format of the result coverage data.

method.name: getResultFile
method.doc: Provides information about the data file containing the result coverage data.

interface.doc: Result of a data quality measure organising the measured values as a coverage.

interface.name: DataQuality

method.name: getScope
method.doc: The specific data to which the data quality information applies.

method.name: getReports
method.doc: Quantitative quality information for the data specified by the scope. Shall be provided only if scope level is dataset.

method.name: getLineage
method.doc: Non-quantitative quality information about the lineage of the data specified by the scope. Shall be provided only if scope level is dataset.

interface.doc: Quality information for the data specified by a data quality scope.

interface.name: DomainConsistency
interface.doc: Adherence of values to the value domains.

interface.name: Element

method.name: getNamesOfMeasure
method.doc: Name of the test applied to the data.

method.name: getMeasureIdentification
method.doc: Code identifying a registered standard procedure, or null if none.

method.name: getMeasureDescription
method.doc: Description of the measure being determined.

method.name: getEvaluationMethodType
method.doc: Type of method used to evaluate quality of the dataset, or null if unspecified.

method.name: getEvaluationMethodDescription
method.doc: Description of the evaluation method.

method.name: getEvaluationProcedure
method.doc: Reference to the procedure information, or null if none.

method.name: getDates
method.doc:
Date or range of dates on which a data quality measure was applied. The collection size is 1 for a single date, or 2 for a range. Returns an empty collection if this information is not available.
Warning: The element type of this method may change in GeoAPI 3.1 release. It may be replaced by a type matching more closely either ISO 19108 (Temporal Schema) or ISO 19103.

method.name: getResults
method.doc: Value (or set of values) obtained from applying a data quality measure or the out come of evaluating the obtained value (or set of values) against a specified acceptable conformance quality level.

interface.doc: Type of test applied to the data specified by a data quality scope.

class.name: EvaluationMethodType

method.name: values
method.doc: Returns the list of EvaluationMethodTypes.

method.name: family
method.doc: Returns the list of enumerations of the same kind than this enum.

method.name: valueOf
method.doc: Returns the evaluation method type that matches the given string, or returns a new one if none match it.

field.name: DIRECT_INTERNAL
field.doc: Method of evaluating the quality of a dataset based on inspection of items within the dataset, where all data required is internal to the dataset being evaluated.

field.name: DIRECT_EXTERNAL
field.doc: Method of evaluating the quality of a dataset based on inspection of items within the dataset, where reference data external to the dataset being evaluated is required.

field.name: INDIRECT
field.doc: Method of evaluating the quality of a dataset based on external knowledge.

class.doc: Type of method for evaluating an identified data quality measure.

interface.name: FormatConsistency
interface.doc: Degree to which data is stored in accordance with the physical structure of the dataset, as described by the scope.

interface.name: GriddedDataPositionalAccuracy
interface.doc: Closeness of gridded data position values to values accepted as or being true.

interface.name: LogicalConsistency
interface.doc: Degree of adherence to logical rules of data structure, attribution and relationships (data structure can be conceptual, logical or physical).

interface.name: NonQuantitativeAttributeAccuracy
interface.doc: Accuracy of non-quantitative attributes.

interface.name: PositionalAccuracy
interface.doc: Accuracy of the position of features.

interface.name: QuantitativeAttributeAccuracy
interface.doc: Accuracy of quantitative attributes.

interface.name: QuantitativeResult

method.name: getValues
method.doc: Quantitative value or values, content determined by the evaluation procedure used.

method.name: getValueType
method.doc: Value type for reporting a data quality result, or null if none.

method.name: getValueUnit
method.doc: Value unit for reporting a data quality result, or null if none.

method.name: getErrorStatistic
method.doc: Statistical method used to determine the value, or null if none.

interface.doc: Information about the value (or set of values) obtained from applying a data quality measure.

interface.name: RelativeInternalPositionalAccuracy
interface.doc: Closeness of the relative positions of features in the scope to their respective relative positions accepted as or being true.

interface.name: Result
interface.doc: Base interface of more specific result classes.

interface.name: Scope

method.name: getLevel
method.doc: Hierarchical level of the data specified by the scope.

method.name: getLevelDescription
method.doc: Detailed description about the level of the data specified by the scope. Shall be defined only if the level is not equal to DATASET or SERIES.

method.name: getExtent
method.doc: Information about the spatial, vertical and temporal extent of the data specified by the scope.

interface.doc: Description of the data specified by the scope.

interface.name: TemporalAccuracy
interface.doc: Accuracy of the temporal attributes and temporal relationships of features.

interface.name: TemporalConsistency
interface.doc: Correctness of ordered events or sequences, if reported.

interface.name: TemporalValidity
interface.doc: Validity of data specified by the scope with respect to time.

interface.name: ThematicAccuracy
interface.doc: Accuracy of quantitative attributes and the correctness of non-quantitative attributes and of the classifications of features and their relationships.

interface.name: ThematicClassificationCorrectness
interface.doc: Comparison of the classes assigned to features or their attributes to a universe of discourse.

interface.name: TopologicalConsistency
interface.doc: Correctness of the explicitly encoded topological characteristics of the dataset as described by the scope.

interface.name: Usability
interface.doc: Degree of adherence of a dataset to a specific set of user requirements.

class.name: CellGeometry

method.name: family

field.name: POINT
field.doc: Each cell represents a point.

field.name: AREA
field.doc: Each cell represents an area.

class.doc: Code indicating whether grid data is point or area.

method.name: getDimensionName
method.doc: Name of the axis.

Degree of detail in the grid dataset.
Warning: The return type of this method may change in GeoAPI 3.1. It may be replaced by the Quantity type in order to provide unit of measurement together with the value.

interface.doc: Axis properties.

field.name: COLUMN

field.name: VERTICAL

field.name: TRACK
field.doc: Along the direction of motion of the scan point

field.name: CROSS_TRACK
field.doc: Perpendicular to the direction of motion of the scan point.

field.name: LINE
field.doc: Scan line of a sensor.

field.name: SAMPLE
field.doc: Element along a scan line.

field.name: TIME
field.doc: Duration.

class.doc: Name of the dimension.

interface.name: GCP

method.name: getGeographicCoordinates
method.doc: Geographic or map position of the control point, in either two or three dimensions.

method.name: getAccuracyReports
method.doc: Accuracy of a ground control point.

interface.doc: Information on ground control point.

interface.name: GCPCollection

method.name: getCollectionIdentification
method.doc: Identifier of the GCP collection.

method.name: getCollectionName
method.doc: Name of the GCP collection.

method.name: getCoordinateReferenceSystem
method.doc: Coordinate system in which the ground control points are defined.

method.name: getGCPs
method.doc: Ground control point(s) used in the collection.

interface.doc: Information about a control point collection.

interface.name: GeolocationInformation

method.name: getQualityInfo
method.doc: Provides an overall assessment of quality of geolocation information.

interface.doc: Information used to determine geographic location corresponding to image location.

interface.name: GeometricObjects

method.name: getGeometricObjectType
method.doc: Name of point and vector spatial objects used to locate zero-, one-, and twodimensional spatial locations in the dataset.

method.name: getGeometricObjectCount
method.doc: Total number of the point or vector object type occurring in the dataset.

interface.doc: Number of objects, listed by geometric object type, used in the dataset.

class.name: GeometricObjectType

method.name: values
method.doc: Returns the list of GeometricObjectTypes.

method.name: family
method.doc: Returns the list of enumerations of the same kind than this enum.

method.name: valueOf
method.doc: Returns the geometric object type that matches the given string, or returns a new one if none match it.

field.name: COMPLEX
field.doc: Set of geometric primitives such that their boundaries can be represented as a union of other primitives.

field.name: COMPOSITE
field.doc: Connected set of curves, solids or surfaces.

field.name: CURVE
field.doc: Bounded, 1-dimensional geometric primitive, representing the continuous image of a line.

field.name: POINT
field.doc: Zero-dimensional geometric primitive, representing a position but not having an extent.

field.name: SOLID
field.doc: Bounded, connected 3-dimensional geometric primitive, representing the continuous image of a region of space.

field.name: SURFACE
field.doc: Bounded, connected 2-dimensional geometric, representing the continuous image of a region of a plane.

class.doc: Name of point and vector spatial objects used to locate zero-, one-, and twodimensional spatial locations in the dataset.

interface.name: Georectified

method.name: isCheckPointAvailable
method.doc: Indication of whether or not geographic position points are available to test the accuracy of the georeferenced grid data.

method.name: getCheckPointDescription
method.doc: Description of geographic position points used to test the accuracy of the georeferenced grid data.

method.name: getCornerPoints
method.doc: Earth location in the coordinate system defined by the Spatial Reference System and the grid coordinate of the cells at opposite ends of grid coverage along two diagonals in the grid spatial dimensions. There are four corner points in a georectified grid; at least two corner points along one diagonal are required.

method.name: getCenterPoint
method.doc: Earth location in the coordinate system defined by the Spatial Reference System and the grid coordinate of the cell halfway between opposite ends of the grid in the spatial dimensions.

method.name: getPointInPixel
method.doc: Point in a pixel corresponding to the Earth location of the pixel.

method.name: getTransformationDimensionDescription
method.doc: Description of the information about which grid dimensions are the spatial dimensions.

method.name: getTransformationDimensionMapping
method.doc: Information about which grid dimensions are the spatial dimensions.

method.name: getCheckPoints
method.doc: Geographic references used to validate georectification of the data.

interface.doc: Grid whose cells are regularly spaced in a geographic (i.e., lat / long) or map coordinate system defined in the Spatial Referencing System (SRS) so that any cell in the grid can be geolocated given its grid coordinate and the grid origin, cell spacing, and orientation indication of whether or not geographic.

interface.name: Georeferenceable

method.name: isControlPointAvailable
method.doc: Indication of whether or not control point(s) exists.

method.name: isOrientationParameterAvailable
method.doc: Indication of whether or not orientation parameters are available.

method.name: getOrientationParameterDescription
method.doc: Description of parameters used to describe sensor orientation.

method.name: getGeoreferencedParameters
method.doc: Terms which support grid data georeferencing.

method.name: getParameterCitations
method.doc: Reference providing description of the parameters.

method.name: getGeolocationInformation
method.doc: Information that can be used to geolocate the data.

interface.doc: Grid with cells irregularly spaced in any given geographic/map projection coordinate system, whose individual cells can be geolocated using geolocation information supplied with the data but cannot be geolocated from the grid properties alone.

interface.name: GridSpatialRepresentation

method.name: getNumberOfDimensions
method.doc: Number of independent spatial-temporal axes.

method.name: getAxisDimensionProperties
method.doc: Information about spatial-temporal axis properties.

method.name: getCellGeometry
method.doc: Identification of grid data as point or cell.

method.name: isTransformationParameterAvailable
method.doc: Indication of whether or not parameters for transformation exists.

interface.doc: Basic information required to uniquely identify a resource or resources.

class.name: PixelOrientation

method.name: values
method.doc: Returns the list of PixelOrientations.

method.name: family
method.doc: Returns the list of enumerations of the same kind than this enum.

method.name: valueOf
method.doc: Returns the pixel orientation that matches the given string, or returns a new one if none match it.

field.name: CENTER
field.doc: Point in a pixel corresponding to the Earth location of the pixel.

field.name: LOWER_LEFT
field.doc: The corner in the pixel closest to the origin of the SRS; if two are at the same distance from the origin, the one with the smallest x-value.

field.name: LOWER_RIGHT
field.doc: Next corner counterclockwise from the lower left.

field.name: UPPER_RIGHT
field.doc: Next corner counterclockwise from the lower right.

field.name: UPPER_LEFT
field.doc: Next corner counterclockwise from the upper right.

class.doc: Point in a pixel corresponding to the Earth location of the pixel. This code list is restricted to the two-dimensional case. A similar code list, PixelInCell, can be used for n-dimensional grid cell.

interface.name: SpatialRepresentation
interface.doc: Digital mechanism used to represent spatial information.

class.name: SpatialRepresentationType

method.name: values
method.doc: Returns the list of SpatialRepresentationTypes.

method.name: family
method.doc: Returns the list of enumerations of the same kind than this enum.

method.name: valueOf
method.doc: Returns the spatial representation type that matches the given string, or returns a new one if none match it.

field.name: VECTOR
field.doc: Vector data is used to represent geographic data.

field.name: GRID
field.doc: Grid data is used to represent geographic data.

field.name: TEXT_TABLE
field.doc: Textual or tabular data is used to represent geographic data.

field.name: TIN
field.doc: Triangulated irregular network.

field.name: STEREO_MODEL
field.doc: Three-dimensional view formed by the intersecting homologous rays of an overlapping pair of images.

field.name: VIDEO
field.doc: Scene from a video recording.

class.doc: Method used to represent geographic information in the dataset.

class.name: TopologyLevel

method.name: values
method.doc: Returns the list of TopologyLevels.

method.name: family
method.doc: Returns the list of enumerations of the same kind than this enum.

method.name: valueOf
method.doc: Returns the topology level that matches the given string, or returns a new one if none match it.

field.name: GEOMETRY_ONLY
field.doc: Geometry objects without any additional structure which describes topology.

field.name: TOPOLOGY_1D
field.doc: 1-dimensional topological complex.

field.name: PLANAR_GRAPH
field.doc: 1-dimensional topological complex which is planar.

field.name: FULL_PLANAR_GRAPH
field.doc: 2-dimensional topological complex which is planar.

field.name: SURFACE_GRAPH
field.doc: 1-dimensional topological complex which is isomorphic to a subset of a surface.

field.name: FULL_SURFACE_GRAPH
field.doc: 2-dimensional topological complex which is isomorphic to a subset of a surface.

field.name: TOPOLOGY_3D
field.doc: 3-dimensional topological complex.

field.name: FULL_TOPOLOGY_3D
field.doc: Complete coverage of a 3D coordinate space.

field.name: ABSTRACT

class.doc: Degree of complexity of the spatial relationships.

interface.name: VectorSpatialRepresentation

method.name: getTopologyLevel
method.doc: Code which identifies the degree of complexity of the spatial relationships.

method.name: getGeometricObjects
method.doc: Information about the geometric objects used in the dataset.

interface.doc: Information about the vector spatial objects in the dataset.

interface.name: GeneralParameterDescriptor

method.name: createValue
method.doc: Creates a new instance of parameter value or group initialized with the default value(s). The parameter value descriptor for the created parameter value(s) will be this object.

method.name: getMinimumOccurs
method.doc: The minimum number of times that values for this parameter group or parameter are required. The default value is one. A value of 0 means an optional parameter.

method.name: getMaximumOccurs
method.doc: The maximum number of times that values for this parameter group or parameter can be included. For a single parameter, the value is always 1. For a parameter group, it may vary. The default value is one.

interface.doc: Abstract definition of a parameter or group of parameters used by an operation method.

interface.name: GeneralParameterValue

method.name: getDescriptor
method.doc: Returns the abstract definition of this parameter or group of parameters.

method.name: clone
method.doc: Returns a copy of this parameter value or group.

interface.doc: Abstract parameter value or group of parameter values.

class.name: InvalidParameterCardinalityException

constructor.name: InvalidParameterCardinalityException
constructor.doc: Creates an exception with the specified message and parameter name.

method.name: getParameterName
method.doc: Returns the name of the parameter with invalid cardinality.

class.doc: Thrown by ParameterValueGroup if adding or removing a parameter value would result in more or less parameters than the expected range. The [minimum … maximum] range is defined by the ParameterDescriptorGroup instance associated with the ParameterValueGroup. This exception may be thrown directly by the addGroup(String) method, or indirectly during the add or remove operations on the list returned by values(). exception is of kind IllegalStateException instead than IllegalArgumentException because it is not caused by a bad argument. It is rather a consequence of an ParameterValueGroup being "full".

class.name: InvalidParameterNameException

constructor.name: InvalidParameterNameException
constructor.doc: Creates an exception with the specified message and parameter name.

method.name: getParameterName
method.doc: Returns the invalid parameter name.

class.doc: Thrown when an unexpected parameter was found in a parameter group.

class.name: InvalidParameterTypeException

constructor.name: InvalidParameterTypeException
constructor.doc: Creates an exception with the specified message and parameter name.

method.name: getParameterName
method.doc: Returns the parameter name.

class.doc: Thrown by ParameterValue getter methods when a value can not be casted to the requested type. For example this exception is thrown when doubleValue() is invoked but the value is not convertible to a double. exception is of kind IllegalStateException instead than IllegalArgumentException because it is not caused by a bad argument. It is rather a consequence of a zero-argument method invoked in a context where is it not allowed.

class.name: InvalidParameterValueException

constructor.name: InvalidParameterValueException
constructor.doc: Creates an exception with the specified invalid value.

constructor.name: InvalidParameterValueException
constructor.doc: Creates an exception with the specified invalid value as a floating point.

constructor.name: InvalidParameterValueException
constructor.doc: Creates an exception with the specified invalid value as an integer.

method.name: getParameterName
method.doc: Returns the parameter name.

method.name: getValue
method.doc: Returns the invalid parameter value.

class.doc: Thrown by ParameterValue setter methods when they are given an invalid value.

interface.name: ParameterDescriptor

method.name: createValue
method.doc: Creates a new instance of parameter value initialized with the default value. The parameter value descriptor for the created parameter value will be this object.

method.name: getValueClass
method.doc: Returns the class that describe the type of the parameter.

method.name: getValidValues
method.doc: Returns the set of allowed values when these are restricted to some finite set or returns null otherwise. The returned set usually contains code list or enumeration elements.

method.name: getDefaultValue
method.doc: Returns the default value for the parameter. The return type can be any type including a Number or a String. If there is no default value, then this method returns null.

method.name: getMinimumValue
method.doc: Returns the minimum parameter value. If there is no minimum value, or if minimum value is inappropriate for the parameter type, then this method returns null. When the getValueClass() is an array or Collection getMinimumValue may be used to constrain the contained elements.

method.name: getMaximumValue
method.doc: Returns the maximum parameter value. If there is no maximum value, or if maximum value is inappropriate for the parameter type, then this method returns null. When the getValueClass() is an array or Collection getMaximumValue may be used to constraint the contained elements.

method.name: getUnit
method.doc: Returns the unit for default, minimum and maximum values. This attribute apply only if the values is of numeric type (usually an instance of Double).

interface.doc: The definition of a parameter used by an operation method. Most parameter values are numeric, but other types of parameter values are possible.

interface.name: ParameterDescriptorGroup

method.name: createValue
method.doc: Creates a new instance of parameter value group initialized with the default values. The parameter value descriptor for the created group will be this object. The number of ParameterValue objects included must be between the minimum and maximum occurences required. For example: For ParameterDescriptor with cardinality 1:* a ParameterValue will be included with the default value (even if this default value is null). For ParameterDescriptor with cardinality 0:* no entry is required. ParameterValue entries may be created only as needed.

method.name: descriptors
method.doc: Returns the parameters in this group.

method.name: descriptor
method.doc: Returns the parameter descriptor in this group for the specified identifier code.

interface.doc: The definition of a group of related parameters used by an operation method.

class.name: ParameterNotFoundException

constructor.name: ParameterNotFoundException
constructor.doc: Creates an exception with the specified message and parameter name.

method.name: getParameterName
method.doc: Returns the name of the parameter which was required but not found.

class.doc: Thrown by ParameterValueGroup and ParameterDescriptorGroup when a parameter is requested but not found in that group.

interface.name: ParameterValue

method.name: getDescriptor
method.doc: Returns the abstract definition of this parameter value.

method.name: getUnit
method.doc: Returns the unit of measure of the parameter value. If the parameter value has no unit (for example because it is a String type), then this method returns null. Note that "no unit" doesn't means "dimensionless".

method.name: doubleValue
method.doc: Returns the numeric value of the coordinate operation parameter in the specified unit of measure. This convenience method applies unit conversion on the fly as needed.

method.name: doubleValue
method.doc: Returns the numeric value of the coordinate operation parameter with its associated unit of measure.

method.name: intValue
method.doc: Returns the positive integer value of an operation parameter, usually used for a count. An integer value does not have an associated unit of measure.

method.name: booleanValue
method.doc: Returns the boolean value of an operation parameter A boolean value does not have an associated unit of measure.

method.name: stringValue
method.doc: Returns the string value of an operation parameter. A string value does not have an associated unit of measure.

method.name: doubleValueList
method.doc: Returns an ordered sequence of numeric values in the specified unit of measure. This convenience method applies unit conversions on the fly as needed.

method.name: doubleValueList
method.doc: Returns an ordered sequence of two or more numeric values of an operation parameter list, where each value has the same associated unit of measure.

method.name: intValueList
method.doc: Returns an ordered sequence of two or more integer values of an operation parameter list, usually used for counts. These integer values do not have an associated unit of measure.

method.name: valueFile
method.doc: Returns a reference to a file or a part of a file containing one or more parameter values. When referencing a part of a file, that file must contain multiple identified parts, such as an XML encoded document. Furthermore, the referenced file or part of a file can reference another part of the same or different files, as allowed in XML documents.

method.name: getValue
method.doc: Returns the parameter value as an object. The object type is typically a Double, Integer, Boolean, String, URI, double[] or int[]. If no value has been set, then this method returns the default value (which may be null).

method.name: setValue
method.doc: Sets the parameter value as an array of floating point and their associated unit.

method.name: setValue
method.doc: Sets the parameter value as a floating point and its associated unit.

method.name: setValue
method.doc: Sets the parameter value as a floating point.

method.name: setValue
method.doc: Set the parameter value as an integer.

method.name: setValue
method.doc: Set the parameter value as a boolean.

method.name: setValue
method.doc: Set the parameter value as an object. The object type is typically a Double, Integer, Boolean, String, URI, double[] or int[]. The argument is not restricted to the parameterized type T because the type is typically unknown (as in group.parameter("name").setValue(value)) and because some implementations may choose to convert a wider range of types.

method.name: clone
method.doc: Returns a copy of this parameter value.

interface.doc: A parameter value used by an operation method. Most parameter values are numeric and can be obtained by the intValue() or doubleValue() methods. But other types of parameter values are possible and can be handled by the more generic getValue() and setValue(Object) methods. The type and constraints on parameter values are given by the descriptor. Instances of ParameterValue are created by the createValue() method.

interface.name: ParameterValueGroup

method.name: getDescriptor
method.doc: The abstract definition of this group of parameters.

method.name: values
method.doc: Returns the values in this group. The returned list may or may not be unmodifiable; this is implementation-dependent. However, if some aspects of this list are modifiable, then any modification shall be reflected back into this ParameterValueGroup. More specifically: If the list supports the add operation, then it should ensure that the added general parameter value is valid and can be added to this group. An InvalidParameterCardinalityException (or any other appropriate exception) shall be thrown if it is not the case. The list may also supports the remove operation as a way to remove parameter created by the parameter(String) method.

method.name: parameter
method.doc: Returns the value in this group for the specified identifier code. If no parameter value is found but a parameter descriptor is found (which may occurs if the parameter is optional, i.e. minimumOccurs == 0), then a parameter value is automatically created and initialized to its default value (if any). This convenience method provides a way to get and set parameter values by name. For example the following idiom fetches a floating point value for the "false_easting" parameter: double value = parameter("false_easting").doubleValue(); This method do not search recursively in subgroups. This is because more than one subgroup may exist for the same descriptor. The user must query all subgroups and select explicitly the appropriate one to use.

method.name: groups
method.doc: Returns all subgroups with the specified name. This method do not create new groups. If the requested group is optional (i.e. minimumOccurs == 0) and no value were defined previously, then this method returns an empty set.

method.name: addGroup
method.doc: Creates a new group of the specified name. The specified name must be the identifier code of a descriptor group.

method.name: clone
method.doc: Returns a copy of this group of parameter values. Included parameter values and subgroups are cloned recursively.

interface.doc: A group of related parameter values. The same group can be repeated more than once in an coordinate operation or higher level ParameterValueGroup, if those instances contain different values of one or more ParameterValues which suitably distinquish among those groups.

interface.name: AuthorityFactory

method.name: getAuthority
method.doc: Returns the organization or party responsible for definition and maintenance of the database.

method.name: getAuthorityCodes
method.doc: Returns the set of authority codes of the given type. The type argument specifies the base class. For example if this factory is an instance of CRSAuthorityFactory, then: CoordinateReferenceSystem.class  asks for all authority codes accepted by one of createGeographicCRS, createProjectedCRS, createVerticalCRS, createTemporalCRS and any other method returning a sub-type of CoordinateReferenceSystem. ProjectedCRS.class  asks only for authority codes accepted by createProjectedCRS.

method.name: getDescriptionText
method.doc: Gets a description of the object corresponding to a code.

method.name: createObject
method.doc: Returns an arbitrary object from a code. The returned object will typically be an instance of Datum, CoordinateSystem, ReferenceSystem or CoordinateOperation. If the type of the object is know at compile time, it is recommended to invoke the most precise method instead of this one (for example  createCoordinateReferenceSystem(code)  instead of  createObject(code)  if the caller know he is asking for a coordinate reference system).

interface.doc: Base interface for all authority factories. An authority is an organization that maintains definitions of authority codes. An authority code is a compact string defined by an authority to reference a particular spatial reference object. For example the European Petroleum Survey Group (EPSG) maintains a database of coordinate systems, and other spatial referencing objects, where each object has a code number ID. For example, the EPSG code for a WGS84 Lat/Lon coordinate system is '4326'.

interface.name: IdentifiedObject

method.name: getName
method.doc: The primary name by which this object is identified.

method.name: getAlias
method.doc: An alternative name by which this object is identified.

method.name: getIdentifiers
method.doc: An identifier which references elsewhere the object's defining information. Alternatively an identifier by which this object can be referenced.

method.name: getRemarks
method.doc: Comments on or information about this object, including data source information.

method.name: toWKT
method.doc: Returns a Well Known Text (WKT) for this object. This operation may fails if an object is too complex for the WKT format capability (for example an engineering CRS with different unit for each axis).

field.name: NAME_KEY
field.doc: Key for the {@value} property to be given to the object factory createFoo(…) methods. This is used for setting the value to be returned by getName().

field.name: ALIAS_KEY
field.doc: Key for the {@value} property to be given to the object factory createFoo(…) methods. This is used for setting the value to be returned by getAlias().

field.name: IDENTIFIERS_KEY
field.doc: Key for the {@value} property to be given to the object factory createFoo(…) methods. This is used for setting the value to be returned by getIdentifiers().

field.name: REMARKS_KEY
field.doc: Key for the {@value} property to be given to the object factory createFoo(…) methods. This is used for setting the value to be returned by getRemarks().

interface.doc: Supplementary identification and remarks information for a CRS or CRS-related object. When CRSAuthorityFactory is used to create an object, the authority and authority code values shall be set to the authority name of the factory object, and the authority code supplied by the client, respectively. The other values may or may not be set. If the authority is EPSG, the implementer may consider using the corresponding metadata values in the EPSG tables.

class.name: NoSuchAuthorityCodeException

constructor.name: NoSuchAuthorityCodeException
constructor.doc: Constructs an exception with the specified detail message and authority code.

constructor.name: NoSuchAuthorityCodeException
constructor.doc: Constructs an exception with the specified detail message, authority code and identifier. The identifier argument is optional. If omitted, then "authority:code" will be used.

method.name: getAuthority
method.doc: Returns the authority.

method.name: getAuthorityCode
method.doc: Returns the invalid authority code.

class.doc: Thrown when an authority factory can't find the requested authority code.

interface.name: ObjectFactory
interface.doc:
Base interface for all factories of identified objects. Factories build up complex objects from simpler objects or values. This factory allows applications to make coordinate systems, datum or coordinate reference systems that cannot be created by an authority factory. This factory is very flexible, whereas the authority factory is easier to use. Object properties Most factory methods expect a Map argument. The map can be a Properties instance. The map shall contains at least a "name" property. In the common case where the name is the only property, the map may be constructed with Collections.singletonMap("name", theName) where theName is an arbitrary name as free text. Implementations are encouraged to recognize at least the properties listed in the following table. Additional implementation-specific properties can be added. Unknown properties shall be ignored.
Property name Value type Value given to
 NAME_KEY   ReferenceIdentifier or String   getName()
 ALIAS_KEY   String, String[], GenericName or GenericName[]   getAlias()
 AUTHORITY_KEY   String or Citation   getAuthority() on the name
 CODESPACE_KEY   String   getCodeSpace() on the name
 VERSION_KEY   String   getVersion() on the name
 IDENTIFIERS_KEY   Identifier or Identifier[]   getIdentifiers()
 REMARKS_KEY   String or InternationalString   getRemarks()
The "name" property is mandatory. All others are optional. All localizable attributes like "remarks" can have a language and country code suffix. For example the "remarks_fr" property stands for remarks in French and the "remarks_fr_CA" property stands for remarks in French Canadian.

interface.name: ReferenceIdentifier

method.name: getCodeSpace
method.doc: Name or identifier of the person or organization responsible for namespace.

method.name: getVersion
method.doc: Version identifier for the namespace, as specified by the code authority. When appropriate, the edition is identified by the effective date, coded using ISO 8601 date format.

field.name: CODESPACE_KEY
field.doc: Key for the {@value} property to be given to the CRS factory createFoo(…) methods. This is used for setting the value to be returned by getCodeSpace().

field.name: VERSION_KEY
field.doc: Key for the {@value} property to be given to the CRS factory createFoo(…) methods. This is used for setting the value to be returned by getVersion().

interface.doc: Identifier used for reference systems.

interface.name: ReferenceSystem

method.name: getDomainOfValidity
method.doc: Area or region or timeframe in which this (coordinate) reference system is valid.

method.name: getScope
method.doc: Description of domain of usage, or limitations of usage, for which this Reference System object is valid.

field.name: DOMAIN_OF_VALIDITY_KEY
field.doc: Key for the {@value} property to be given to the object factory createFoo(…) methods. This is used for setting the value to be returned by getDomainOfValidity().

field.name: SCOPE_KEY
field.doc: Key for the {@value} property to be given to the object factory createFoo(…) methods. This is used for setting the value to be returned by getScope().

interface.doc: Description of a spatial and temporal reference system used by a dataset.

interface.name: CompoundCRS

method.name: getComponents
method.doc: The ordered list of coordinate reference systems.

interface.doc: A coordinate reference system describing the position of points through two or more independent coordinate reference systems. Thus it is associated with two or more Coordinate Systems and Datums by defining the compound CRS as an ordered set of two or more instances of CoordinateReferenceSystem. In general, a Compound CRS may contain any number of axes. The Compound CRS contains an ordered set of coordinate reference systems and the tuple order of a compound coordinate set shall follow that order, while the subsets of the tuple, described by each of the composing coordinate reference systems, follow the tuple order valid for their respective coordinate reference systems. For spatial coordinates, a number of constraints exist for the construction of Compound CRSs. For example, the coordinate reference systems that are combined should not contain any duplicate or redundant axes. Valid combinations include: Geographic 2D + Vertical Geographic 2D + Engineering 1D (near vertical) Projected + Vertical Projected + Engineering 1D (near vertical) Engineering (horizontal 2D or 1D linear) + Vertical Any coordinate reference system, or any of the above listed combinations of coordinate reference systems, can have a Temporal CRS added. More than one Temporal CRS may be added if these axes represent different time quantities. For example, the oil industry sometimes uses "4D seismic", by which is meant seismic data with the vertical axis expressed in milliseconds (signal travel time). A second time axis indicates how it changes with time (years), e.g. as a reservoir is gradually exhausted of its recoverable oil or gas).

interface.name: CoordinateReferenceSystem

method.name: getCoordinateSystem
method.doc: Returns a relevant coordinate system instance. Special cases: If the CRS instance on which this method is invoked is an instance of the single CRS interface, then the CS instance which is returned shall be one of the defined sub-interfaces of coordinate system. If the CRS instance on which this method is invoked is an instance of the compound CRS interface, then the CS instance which is returned shall have dimension and axis components obtained from different components of the instance CRS.

interface.doc: Abstract coordinate reference system, usually defined by a coordinate system and a datum. The concept of a coordinate reference system (CRS) captures the choice of values for the parameters that constitute the degrees of freedom of the coordinate space. The fact that such a choice has to be made, either arbitrarily or by adopting values from survey measurements, leads to the large number of coordinate reference systems in use around the world. It is also the cause of the little understood fact that the latitude and longitude of a point are not unique. Without the full specification of the coordinate reference system, coordinates are ambiguous at best and meaningless at worst. However for some interchange purposes it is sufficient to confirm the identity of the system without necessarily having the full system definition. The concept of coordinates may be expanded from a strictly spatial context to include time. Time is then added as another coordinate to the coordinate tuple. It is even possible to add two time-coordinates, provided the two coordinates describe different independent quantities. An example of the latter is the time/space position of a subsurface point of which the vertical coordinate is expressed as the two-way travel time of a sound signal in milliseconds, as is common in seismic imaging. A second time-coordinate indicates the time of observation, usually expressed in whole years.

interface.name: CRSAuthorityFactory

method.name: createCoordinateReferenceSystem
method.doc: Returns an arbitrary coordinate reference system from a code. If the coordinate reference system type is know at compile time, it is recommended to invoke the most precise method instead of this one (for example  createGeographicCRS(code)  instead of  createCoordinateReferenceSystem(code)  if the caller know he is asking for a geographic coordinate reference system).

method.name: createCompoundCRS
method.doc: Creates a 3D coordinate reference system from a code.

method.name: createDerivedCRS
method.doc: Creates a derived coordinate reference system from a code.

method.name: createEngineeringCRS
method.doc: Create a engineering coordinate reference system from a code.

method.name: createGeographicCRS
method.doc: Returns a geographic coordinate reference system from a code.

method.name: createGeocentricCRS
method.doc: Returns a geocentric coordinate reference system from a code.

method.name: createImageCRS
method.doc: Create a image coordinate reference system from a code.

method.name: createProjectedCRS
method.doc: Returns a projected coordinate reference system from a code.

method.name: createTemporalCRS
method.doc: Create a temporal coordinate reference system from a code.

method.name: createVerticalCRS
method.doc: Create a vertical coordinate reference system from a code.

interface.doc: Creates coordinate reference systems using authority codes. External authorities are used to manage definitions of objects used in this interface. The definitions of these objects are referenced using code strings. A commonly used authority is EPSG, which is also used in the GeoTIFF standard.

interface.name: CRSFactory

method.name: createCompoundCRS
method.doc: Creates a compound coordinate reference system from an ordered list of CoordinateReferenceSystem objects.

method.name: createEngineeringCRS
method.doc: Creates a engineering coordinate reference system.

method.name: createImageCRS
